meanings.definition: To cancel (a postage stamp) before use.
meanings.sent1: I precancel my stamps to make sure they are ready to send.
meanings.sent2: Remember to precancel the stamp before putting it on the envelope.
meanings.sent3: Why did the stamp decide to precancel itself before the letter was even written?
meanings.sent4: Her decision to precancel the stamp was like stopping a story before it began.
meanings.sent5: The post office worker showed me how to precancel the stamp with a special tool.

meanings.definition: A postage stamp that has been precanceled.
meanings.sent1: I collected a rare precancel for my stamp album.
meanings.sent2: The precancel on the stamp indicated it was used for official mail.
meanings.sent3: The precancel looked like a secret code on the stamp.
meanings.sent4: The precancel on the stamp was a mark of its early journey.
meanings.sent5: The precancel made the stamp unique among the others in the collection.

meanings.definition: The act of precanceling postage stamps.
meanings.sent1: The precancel of stamps is done to save time at the post office.
meanings.sent2: She learned the art of precancel during her training at the post office.
meanings.sent3: The precanceling of stamps became a fun challenge for the workers.
meanings.sent4: The precanceling process was like a dance of efficiency in the post office.
meanings.sent5: The precision of the precanceling machine amazed the new employee.
